info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Rutherford and Polk Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Columbus, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Forest City, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Spindale, Ellenboro, Bostic, Tryon, Chimney Rock State Park, Cliffside and Green Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western and the Piedmont of North Carolina.
